snippet: Mary Wittenberg of New York Road Runners said the race was “about helping the city,” and Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said this “is a city where we have to go on.”
abstract: New York City Marathon officials press forward with plans for race, while criticism mounts as death toll from Hurricane Sandy rises.

byline.contributor: Juliet Macur, David Chen and Mary Pilon contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mary Wittenberg of New York Road Runners said the race was “about helping the city,” and Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said this “is a city where we have to go on.”

headline.seo: Officials Defend Decision to Run New York City Marathon in Storm’s Aftermath
headline.print_headline: Marathon Presses On as Backlash Builds
